The Accelerating Strategies for Practical Innovation & Research in Economic Strengthening Project (ASPIRES) will develop, monitor and evaluate a package of economic strengthening interventions implemented in collaboration with the five bilateral NGO partners of USAID/SA: National Association for Child Care Workers, Networking AIDS Community of South Africa , Children in Distress, HIV SA, and Futur Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. objectives

The Accelerating Strategies for Practical Innovation & Research in Economic Strengthening Project (ASPIRES) will develop, monitor and evaluate a package of economic strengthening interventions implemented in collaboration with the five bilateral NGO partners of USAID/SA: National Association for Child Care Workers, Networking AIDS Community of South Africa , Children in Distress, HIV SA, and Future Families in KwaZulu Natal, Gauteng, Free State, Northern Cape, Western Cape and Eastern Cape. FHI360 will provide technical assistance to implement a high-quality interventions package in economic strengthening (ES) for vulnerable adolescents. This ES package will focus on encouraging savings (for post-high school use), building financial literacy and combining these interventions with a strong HIV prevention intervention for improved communications skills and knowledge to improve sexual negotiation for an AIDS Free generation. Together these interventions will support improved economic outcomes for the vulnerable adolescents in our program. With improved economic capacities of these vulnerable adolescents the aims is that economic security in the long term will improve with support to access further education, training and entrepreneurial activities. Activities may include matched savings groups, HIV prevention education to strengthen risk reduction, peer-education programs that integrate HIV and AIDS prevention into behavior norms, information on preventing GBV and linkages to HIV testing, treatment and care and support services. FHI360 will develop indicators and an M&E plan and, as appropriate, a protocol for impact evaluation. In addition, a situational analysis/mapping exercise of the current pieces of the intervention is planned.
